text:
<@U01D4JTE8R4> - Follow this:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/speed>

It lists everything I did, except the critical CSS.  I started from the boilerplate which already gets really good scores and then tweaked to fit the look I wanted then as I built I did everything in the guide.

Critical CSS wasn’t a must for my site, but I wanted to reduce CLS further (this was an issue with my own templates and not the boilerplate) and have most of my CSS be loaded asynchronously.

I made a critical-css.css file and did a HubL include, to include it into my base template within a `<style>` tag. Then in that file I included CSS for layout and some of the aesthetic stuff like background colors to reduce what changes between initial load and when the stylesheets kick in.
<@U7SL518D6> I am going to follow this style.. thanks for the advice. I will upload score here once it’s done.
